page.title: 12A Manor House in Jersey
page.content: Trinity Manor was bought in 1909 by the present Seigneur's family. The family undertook extensive alterations, the style of the buildings becoming more French than English. The grounds of the manor are extensive. They include a working farm which grows crops such as potatoes and daffodils as well as having fields for grazing. The manor is the home of the only pack of hunting hounds in the island. They formerly used to hunt real prey such as foxes, but have long since followed a false trail. The present Seigneur is the Master of the Hunt. The position of the Seigneur nowadays is very different from ancient times. The Seigneur has no power over the local people and can expect no dues.
